ygData.subject: Re: terminating a crawl not terminating completely?
ygData.msgSnippet: So if the used memory is at 128000 after completing a crawl, does the next crawl start from that value as a zero point (I know the used memory is never at 0,

So if the used memory is at 128000 after completing a crawl, does the
next crawl start from that value as a "zero point" (I know the used
memory is never at 0, but its very small at initial startup)?

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Kaisa Kaunonen"
<kaisa.kaunonen@h...> wrote:
> Crawler stays alive after all jobs completed
> unless specifically terminated (Shut down Heritrix software -link)
> 
> If you reload the admin console page, while Heritrix is alive
> although not crawling anything, the 'Used memory' value
> grows. Reason is that your reload is recorded in heritrix_out.log
> which grows (well, anyway, I couldn't find any other reason :)
> 
> You can return default memory values,
> 'Used memory' and 'Heap size', by shutting down Heritrix and
> restarting it.
> 
> kk
> 
> 
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "robeger" <reger@a...> wrote:
> > When terminating a crawl in progress I've noticed that the memory
> used
> > value does not go back down after terminating.  It actually appears
> to
> > keep increasing, and the crawler running line still says "yes"
> despite
